ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Crawling HTTPS Subdomains
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Markus, For better or worse, heritrix changes the scheme to http when converting https urls to surt form. So https://sub.domain.com/ in heritrix surt

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Markus,

For better or worse, heritrix changes the scheme to http whe=
n converting
https urls to surt form. So https://sub.domain.com/ in heritri=
x surt form
is http://(com,domain,sub,)/. It will match against your surt
+=
http://(com,domain,.
On the other hand, nothing will match against your +ht=
tps surt.

This means that it's not possible with the stock SurtPrefixedDec=
ideRule to
have https://domain.com/ in scope without http://domain.com/ als=
o being in
scope, and vice versa. Note that this does not apply to other sc=
hemes, so
for instance if you want ftp://domain.com to be in scope, you'll =
need to
include +ftp://(com,domain, in your scope rule.

https://github.com=
/iipc/webarchive-commons/blob/master/src/main/java/org/archive/util/SurtPre=
fixSet.java#L196

Noah


On Thu, Jul 23, 2015 at 5:21 AM, 'Markus.Mirsberge=
r'
markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.=
com>
wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a problem crawling subdomains from https =
websites.
> I am using a seeds file to feed the crawler and as I only want =
crawl
> single domains my seeds file usually looks like this:
>
> http://ww=
w.domain.com/
> +http://(com,domain,
>
> With a seeds file like above every=
thing runs as expected. The crawler will
> crawl all found subdomains from =
domain.com.
> But if I try to crawl a HTTPS Website and start with a seeds =
file like
> that:
>
> https://www.domain.com/
> +https://(com,domain,
>
>
>=
 The crawler will only crawl all pages from https://www.domain.com and
> ig=
nore all links to subdomains like https://sub.domain.com
> Did I miss some =
specific settings for crawling HTTPS sites or does anyone
> know why this h=
appens?
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
>
> 
>

--001a11333a36d0810f051b901b78

<br><br>





    Hi,<br>
    <br>
    I have a problem crawling subdomain=
s from https websites.<br>
    I am using a seeds file to feed the crawler =
and as I only want crawl
    single domains my seeds file usually looks lik=
e this:<br>
    <pre style=3D"color:rgb(0,0,0);font-style:normal;font-varia=
nt:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:normal;text-=
align:start;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;word-spacing:0px;word-wrap:=
break-word;white-space:pre-wrap"><a href=3D"http://www.domain.com/" target=
=3D"_blank">http://www.domain.com/</a>
+http://(com,domain,</pre>
    With =
a seeds file like above everything runs as expected. The
    crawler will c=
rawl all found subdomains from <a href=3D"http://domain.com" target=3D"_bla=
nk">domain.com</a>.<br>
    But if I try to crawl a HTTPS Website and start=
 with a seeds file
    like that:<br>
    
    <pre style=3D"color:rgb(0,0,=
0);font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:=
normal;line-height:normal;text-align:start;text-indent:0px;text-transform:n=
one;word-spacing:0px;word-wrap:break-word;white-space:pre-wrap"><a href=3D"=
https://www.domain.com/" target=3D"_blank">https://www.domain.com/</a>
+htt=
ps://(com,domain,

</pre>
    The crawler will only crawl all pages from <a=
 href=3D"https://www.domain.com" target=3D"_blank">https://www.domain.com</=
a>
    and ignore all links to subdomains like <a href=3D"https://sub.domai=
n.com" target=3D"_blank">https://sub.domain.com</a><br>
    Did I miss some=
 specific settings for crawling HTTPS sites or does
    anyone know why thi=
s happens?<br>
    <br>
    Thanks,<br>
    Markus<br>
  





<br>


<br>
